name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Wow, it's a very popular and beautiful spot. We just went to go for a walk there over Thanksgiving weekend and can't believe how many people are there camping. It looks like a great community and plenty seen to be planning to stay until ...

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Went once and fell I love with the place! Great place for families! Lake is awesome for swimming and kayaking (rentals are available). Lots of trails for walking. Camping sites are decent with washrooms close by. Definitely would go again.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Very nice camping spot. Cozy sites. The faucets in the men's washroom at the Poplar comfort station needs to be changed. It's wasting lots of water and not hygienic as you need to hold the knob as you wash one hand. They should be ...

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Very clean water and not too crowded. There are covered picnic areas that can be used. One can also book the whole picnic shed if there is a large group. There is also a volleyball net with sand underneath the feet. Space is also available for camping if one wants to camp overnight.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review:
Favourite provincial park to camp in so far. The beach surprised us, actually a sandy beach! Lake water was warm once you got in and you could go probably 50 meters before the sand turned to seaweed. 

At the campsites we chose power ...

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Had an awesome experience in section Cedar where we could walk to the beach! second time at this park. great park, friendly staff, overall great campground! only concern would be the fact that more and more of the sites seem to be ...

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Extremely clean, well-maintained park. Busy beach and nice, less-travelled trails.  Would love to see it open in the winter with activities like Arrowhead.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Another good camp area for beginner camping. Its a bit more muddy in camp area more fit for trailer camping.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: I have been coming to this park since I was a child and now I get to bring my own child here! This is the best park I have ever visited! The washrooms and showers are cleaned on a regular cleaning schedule, the beach is beautiful and the ...

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Do you like camping with white trash bros and people who don't know what nature is? Then this is the campground for you! Endless parties on loud campsites, wardens that couldn't care less about rules and sites that are basically on top ...

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: So much fun! Family friendly, great beach. Had an amazing time. Cant wait to go back next summer!

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Very nice. I would suggest mor comfort stations maybe at least 2. We were here on a busy weekend in mid September,  the park was not full but busy, I can't imagine when it is full, as the comfort stations had line ups. We were ...

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Great park. Very nice beach with dog beach too. Our camp site was nice and private and had lots of shade. However, entire site was sand which was a bit of a mess but nice for being bare feet. Park could use some better signage for way finding. Overall was a great stay.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Just beautiful. Had a great day there with the family. The beach had tons of space and picnic tables and we rented a water hammock for a reasonable price. I can't wait to go again.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: I love this park. It offers every type of camping experience from Eco walk in sites to premium electrical along the shore. The lake has beautiful sand beaches and abounds with fish. I've snorkeled the entire shore and found it very ...

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Great park in the Kawartha Lakes. Very nice, long beach with sandy swimming areas. There is a dog beach at one end which is a little bit rockier in places, but still good for swimming. Nice trails.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Great place to go for the day or camping. Tried electric campsite this year. I‚Äôm sold. Bathroom are clear and it‚Äôs closer to the water!

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: The property is great and the beach is beautiful, lots of activities for the kids. Down side is that there is very little done about people being incredibly loud all night, even in radio free quite zones. Ignorant visitors just being ...

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: I love balsam lake provincial park. The sites are nice and the beach is amazing. As long as you get to the beach by 11am you are generally fine to get a nice spot. By 1pm onwards it starts getting very crowded.  If you are driving to the ...

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Balsam lake is a nice park, seems to be getting a little run down. Park Rules do not seem to be enforced. The lake is very nice and clean. The park stores themselves are not like any other provincial park. They are small not well stocked and do not offer many options other then the basics

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Very very nice park. Large clean beach. There's sand. You can rent water toys like paddle boats...never seen this in any provincial parks I've been to. Great for families.  Shallow enough for young kids. Warm water. I don't camp so I can't comment.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review:
It was so lovely here. I can not tell you how clean the comfort center was !!! Annie you do an amazing job! I would come back here again:) 
Thank you for a wonderful weekend

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Good sized campsite with a good mix of sun and shade. Close to a comfort station. Has a pet beach which was perfect to take our dogs to and play in the water.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review:
Clean park..all areas, from comfort stations and showers to beach front.
A variety of campsites from grassy neighborhoods (think Legoland) to forested areas and deep woods 'echo' sites.  Waterfront/beach great for young families/children ...

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Camped here with a few friends. It's a beautiful park with a few short hiking trails, nice sandy beach, and canoe/kayak/paddleboat/etc rentals at a reasonable price. The park office and on-site store are also well-stocked with camping essentials and souvenirs. We will definitely come back again.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Really nice campsites. Some are super private and some even have sand! Bathrooms were clean and lots to do around there. It's a big park. Water was nice but there wete way too many people people for the size of the beach and it wasn't even a long weekend. I would come back again.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Had a great time with our family in early August! Bugs weren't too bad & the beach + walking paths made for some great adventures

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Wonderful spot to camp. Easy access to washroom and hydro on site. A shop to buy wood and ice on site as well. Nice hiking trails.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Been going here with my family for years. There is no better provincial park in Ontario as far as I‚Äôm concerned. This place really is paradise. The staff are always awesome.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review:
Balsam Lake was amazing! The sites are really large and it offers a wide variety of private sites with lots of trees or more open/social sites.

The staff were extremely helpful and efficient.

The beach area is beautiful and perfect for ...

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Great place especially on the thanksgiving long weekend, lots to do theres even trick or treating for the kids. Love fall camping

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Love this park. Comfort stations are clean and in good working order. Beach is a good size and has a place to rent water crafts and buy ice cream. I will be back for sure

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Absolutely beautiful. Just stunning.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Really nice Provincial Park. Clean. Lots of space on the sites.  The website is accurate as to the site you're booking ie. We wanted a shady site and it is. Lots of families come here. Camp store has all the usual basic amenities if you ...

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Beautiful place to visit . Our camping site had plenty of space with tall trees for privacy. An handful of washrooms are new and clean. Lake area is beautiful but its small for the amount of people but plenty of picnic table and shelter.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: The lake is beautiful and great for boating.  We had a good time, and other park patrons were pleasant and respectful.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Great sites. Some have hydro. The Amphitheater is a great place for the kiddos to learn about nature. Friendly staff

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Great park... nice beach... eco-sites are really fantastic. Feels like truly isolated, but you're not really. Amazing starlit sky for a midnight beach walk

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Grear park. The best i have been too in all ontario and ive visited almost 20

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Great beach! Good sand and warm water. The sites good. Poison Ivy around, so keep to the paths.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: We were camping at the 3 group sites. Staff were amazing & accommodated our needs. As we were camping with 80+ youth & sever thunderstorm warnings were in affect. The staff helped with a safe haven evacuation plan to ensure our safety.  Couldn't ask for a better location or staff. Thanks for a great weekend.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Nice campgrounds. The comfort stations are cleaned every day! The staff were very friendly.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Every year we visit the place, we just love it, water is clear, not too crazy busy like the other lakes

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Beautiful nice campgrounds, fishing is abundant..no motor boats for rent though...best paddle on a canoe or kayak! The water is very clear and clean, nice beach to swim on.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Family had a great time here. The place is clean, quiet and lots to do for the kids.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Busy beach, but lots of good campsites if you do your research.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Lots of bugs, but site was nice, lovely if busy beach

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: One of the best provincial parks...great sites and amazimg sandy beach.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Amazing calm peaceful.  Great place to go with family for a day trip or camping.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review:
Great beach but I do not recommend camping here. 
Park rangers were absolutely terrible on my last 2 stays here a few years back. Basically our family was constantly harassed. Literally we are sitting around a campfire talking and ...

review: It was okay, but if you're looking for quiet, this is not your place. We were surrounded by one group of people who had booked at least 5 sites close together. They were constantly walking back and forth between sites, had a super yappy ...

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Love this Park and would recommend it.. It has a beach, fishing, hiking, fellow campers are friendly and it pet friendly

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Great campsites, boat rentals, beach areas, and trails but could use a larger dog-friendly area at the beach that is fenced in so the dogs can play.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Nice place. A lot of poison ivy though

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: This is an ok place to camp if you don‚Äôt want to drive too far for a weekend getaway. But due to my last experience a little over a year ago I will not be returning to camp. For day use, maybe. We were greeted by a very unpleasant park ...

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: A very nice little lake. The beach is not too crowded. There is a lookup trail for the hikers.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Great campground. I'd never heard of it before but the beach needs to be better known. Took the dog to the dog beach and he had a blast!

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Great site. Awesome lake to swim in. And friendly and helpful staff. Couldn't ask for more.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Love day here tripping. That being said the beach can get pretty crowded and not everyone has a respect for personal space or even basic manners

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: I love Balsam! Really well kept. Staff is always friendly and very helpful. Bathrooms are some of the cleanest at the parks.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Large beach with a shallow lake. Lots of rocks in the water, I would wear water shoes if you're not a fan of walking on rocks. Great camp grounds too!

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: sites are good and covered by giant trees. There are pedaling boat, and floating water mat rentals on the beach.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Nice place to camp. Nice beach.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Simply the best beach I have been into this year. The wqter is very warm and it's not overly crowded.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Great lake for Swimming in warm water though always wear a life jacket even though I am a marathon swimmer...great for tent camping, excellent staff.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Beautiful nice beach with clean water. Bonus shady areas with picnic tables right by the water.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Beautiful Lake, very clean park. Staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. Great hiking trails and lots of wildlife to be spotted.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Nice park but I don't need to see it again.

review: Great place but the washroom situation is gross. It's a porta potty with concrete walls.

review: Amazing place to get away. Clean, quiet and love the beach.

review: Enjoyable camp site, nice and close to lots of things for the kids to do.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: The water is so clear and the place is so beautiful.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Overall, very good. However, it gets repetitive after 3 or 4 times. Great for a one time visit during the summer, bot if you're looking for a cottage, move on.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Nice lake.  Great camping

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park

Did a day trip here on the July long weekend. 

The day-use area bathrooms are terrible. Someone could get sick here. Non-flush toilets... disgusting! Day-trippers PAY to use the park too!! Had to use the campers toilets which is allowed ...

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Its a beautiful place, the water is amazing and so is the canoeing, although the park rangers are hit or miss, some are nice and some will yell at you for any little thing.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Fun times. Nice beach.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Very clean and nice

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review:
Pros:
1. Good trails for hiking.
2. Clean waters for a swim
3. You can camp there (but I haven't experienced it personally so can't comment on that)
4. Canoes and kayaks are available for rent at reasonable prices.
Cons:
Lots of bugs at the trails so carry a bug spray for sure.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Very wooded and great privacy.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Big beautiful lake and park

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Always love visiting Balsam!!

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Amazing provincial park. Camped here for 3 night and had a really good time. Canoe and kayaks rentals are I'm short supply though so book those ahead of time. Very clean and friendly campground and I would definitely return.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Loved it here, very clean beach and water.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Sites fairly open, some folks like this.  We don't really, but it was just fine in September as the park wasn't crowded. Park is well kept, good boating, trails for hiking and biking through the park.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Nice place to relax  and have fun with the family

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Great fishing...good lake.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: There was a fire ban at the time but other than that no issues.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: The park and the camping facility is quite clean.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park

review: Best experience I have ever had! Suggest going there if u r an outdoor person üòç

review: Amazing park with clean lake and trails

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Great place to camp for the family so loved it

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Great camp sites and staff

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: A nice place to camp only a couple of hours NE of Toronto and just east of Orillia. Clean lakewater at the accessible beach with a nice playground for kids. Some of the campgrounds are quite open so choose wisely.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Second year spent here fore a week. Love the trails, the beach, & the camp lot. Neighbors vary, but swimming at night in warm water looking at the constellations more than makes up for it!

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: This is our favourite park to go during summer. The beach is always wonderful. I only wish that the washrooms got an upgrade here.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: This is my favourite camp ground! Love the clear water and sandy beach, a dog beach was added this year too! Its never loud like other camp grounds can be, a lot of families and seniors.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Good beach good fishing. Boat launch and dock are well maintained. Could use better bathrooms.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: One of my favourite provincial parks.  We prefer the Eco-sites (no driving in!) as they're a bit more spread-out and you get more of that wilderness feel.  Amazing sandy beach with great swimming.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: One of my favourite spots. I have a lot of family history there

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: While 3/4 of the RV camping facilities resemble a trailer park there are a fair number of remarkable sites down by the lake which are complete with private access to the Lake. The Trailer park area seems to be a wonderful place for kids ...

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Awesome place... We had a fire ban but it didn't stop us. It rained a bit but that's just part of camping and the site was clean and the water was great... Only downside was that too many people were renting boats and they were lots of waiting time to get the next boat.. Recommend to get to the rental shop early...

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Great time, nice beach and trails

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: The beach here is a lot of fun! Nice big camp ground. Great family spot

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Pretty good place to camp, the staff could be friendlier. There are a couple nice members but the park Rangers need to get off their power trips

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Not too far from the city but it seems like the city is forever away when you get here. Love the activities the staff put on and the environment is great. Plenty of beach and you can still find shade as well. And if the beach is packed, there are picnic shelters not too far away.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Beautiful place to go.. Lake is no so deep at beach and smooth for non swimmers. Washrooms needs to be upgraded, so many shelters

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Very nice park, my husband and I went in for the day to go kayaking. Used the boat launch and docks, nice to have 2 launches as it was very busy.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Nice sites.  Washrooms maintained providing staffing is assigned accordingly.  Great trails, nice beach with lots to kid friendly activities. Fisbing5, paddle board/boats for rent. Docking area. Not a far drive from the GTA.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Small park but still very pretty. Beach is fun for the kids and it has some hikes.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Plenty of parking and camp sites. Lots of beaches and a great boat launch. Just like any provincial park there is a small fee to enter for the day or to camp over night. Highly recommend you reserve a spot early in the spring if your looking to camp in the summer.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: This is a beautiful park with excellent options of things to do inside the park.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: One of the best parks close to GTA. Great public beach. Love it.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Beautiful place to stay. Like the lake and camping site. Friendly staff. So many picnic benches. Definitely going back next year.

name: Balsam Lake Provincial Park
review: Great park and camping with lots of stuff to do for kids and a very nice beach. Clean bathrooms that are regularly maintained. That only thing I found that bothered me were the showers. You have keep pushing the button over and over again for weak water presure and lukewarm temps. No 5 stars because of this sorry.
